perturbation.original_text:
WHEREAS, Client desires to obtain access (for itself and for certain of Client's correspondent broker customers) for communications with, and use of, the Interface, including credit bureau information, by transmitting information and data to and receiving information and data from the Interface and such Support Services as Client may from time-to-time specify; and

     WHEREAS, TrueLink is willing to provide to Client and to certain of Client's correspondent broker customers access to the Interface and various Support Services, subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
WHEREAS, Mortgage Logic.com, Inc. desires to obtain access (for itself and for certain of Client's correspondent broker customers) for communications with, and use of, the Interface, including credit bureau information, by transmitting information and data to and receiving information and data from the Interface and such Support Services as Mortgage Logic.com, Inc. may from time-to-time specify; and

     WHEREAS, TrueLink is willing to provide to Mortgage Logic.com, Inc. and to certain of Client's correspondent broker customers access to the Interface and various Support Services, subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the term "Client" to "Mortgage Logic.com, Inc." in the first "WHEREAS" clause and keeping "Client" in the second clause creates uncertainty. It's now ambiguous whether 'Client' in the second 'WHEREAS' refers to the defined 'Client' or 'Mortgage Logic.com, Inc.' It is unclear about whom is TrueLink is willing to provide, potentially contradicting the agreement.

perturbation.original_text: Client will pay TrueLink's fees for requested Hosting Services and Support Services pursuant to the schedule of charges set forth on Exhibits "A" and "B" attached hereto, (but not less than $____ per month for the Hosting Services and $____ per month for Support Services). For any other services agreed to between the parties, Client will pay TrueLink fees which will be determined by the parties and will vary depending on the services utilized. TrueLink will provide Client with an invoice for the requested Hosting Services and Support Services and any other agreed-upon services on a monthly basis. Invoices will be paid within 15 days of receipt.
perturbation.changed_text: Mortgage Logic.com, Inc. will pay TrueLink's fees for requested Hosting Services and Support Services pursuant to the schedule of charges set forth on Exhibits "A" and "B" attached hereto, (but not less than $____ per month for the Hosting Services and $____ per month for Support Services). For any other services agreed to between the parties, Customer will pay TrueLink fees which will be determined by the parties and will vary depending on the services utilized. TrueLink will provide Mortgage Logic.com, Inc. with an invoice for the requested Hosting Services and Support Services and any other agreed-upon services on a monthly basis. Invoices will be paid within 15 days of receipt.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing "Client" with "Mortgage Logic.com, Inc." and introducing the new term "Customer" without defining it creates confusion about who is responsible for payment for 'other services'. "Customer" could refer to Client's customers or a different entity entirely, creating a contradiction about payment obligations.

perturbation.original_text: Client shall indemnify and hold TrueLink, its affiliates, directors, officers, employees, agents and licensors harmless from and against all claims, actions, expenses, losses, and liabilities, including reasonable attorneys' fees, arising from or relating to the following: (i) any claim arising out of any breach by Client of this Agreement, (ii) any claim or demand resulting from any act or omission by Client or any customer of Client granted access to the Interface by Client which constitutes a breach of or default by TrueLink under any System Agreement or Credit Repository Agreement, which breach or default has either not been cured or cannot be cured within the applicable cure period and the consequences of which is that TrueLink will lose material rights it has pursuant to said Agreements or a violation of any state or federal law, rule or regulation (iii) any claim arising out of or relating to the Web Site or Client Content (including, but not limited to, any claim resulting from any content posted to the Web Site by Client or Client's employees, agent or any customer of Client granted access to the Interface by Client), without regard to any knowledge limitation or qualification that may be contained in this Agreement, and (iv) injury or damage to person or property caused by a product, service, or information, whether or not defective, that is sold, distributed or transmitted from the Web Site.
perturbation.changed_text: Mortgage Logic.com, Inc. shall indemnify and hold TrueLink, its affiliates, directors, officers, employees, agents and licensors harmless from and against all claims, actions, expenses, losses, and liabilities, including reasonable attorneys' fees, arising from or relating to the following: (i) any claim arising out of any breach by Client of this Agreement, (ii) any claim or demand resulting from any act or omission by User or any customer of Client granted access to the Interface by Mortgage Logic.com, Inc. which constitutes a breach of or default by TrueLink under any System Agreement or Credit Repository Agreement, which breach or default has either not been cured or cannot be cured within the applicable cure period and the consequences of which is that TrueLink will lose material rights it has pursuant to said Agreements or a violation of any state or federal law, rule or regulation (iii) any claim arising out of or relating to the Web Site or Mortgage Logic.com, Inc. Content (including, but not limited to, any claim resulting from any content posted to the Web Site by Client or Client's employees, agent or any customer of Client granted access to the Interface by Mortgage Logic.com, Inc.), without regard to any knowledge limitation or qualification that may be contained in this Agreement, and (iv) injury or damage to person or property caused by a product, service, or information, whether or not defective, that is sold, distributed or transmitted from the Web Site.
perturbation.explanation: The indemnity clause originally relies on 'Client' as the responsible party. By changing only some instances to 'Mortgage Logic.com, Inc.' and introducing 'User', we create ambiguity. Is "Client" here separate from 'Mortgage Logic.com, Inc.' in (i), requiring both to indemnify? Is the omission of "Client" a deliberate transfer of liability? The inconsistent terminology disrupts clarity.
